page.title: 08 The Hopper Oast Bakery
page.content: Near Chartham Hatch is a small firm called Kent Cakes which makes flan cases and specialist cakes.The firm operates from the Oasthouse Bakery.The business began in 1980.They supply their products to the whole of the UK.The backbone of the business is the production of ready baked pastry cases.The owner believes that they are the only producers in the UK.The business provides employment for 23 people.Future plans include opening the Oast House Bakery to the public and inviting them to look at a Museum in the top of the Oast.In 1932 the Oast had been converted into a cold storage building for apples, the first in the country(and owned by Arnold Fruit Farms).By 1979 it was derelict,to be purchased by the present owner and converted into a bakery.
